sermons.title: (1 John #13) The Exclusiveness of True Love
(So Great A Salvation) Loving Ones Brother
1 Cor 13 (version 1)
sermons.description: This sermon focuses on God's kind of love from the verses written by Paul in 1 Corinthians 13 and Romans 5:5. The majority of the sermon discusses the first half of 1 Cor 13; specifically verses 1 through 8. There are many old hymns and writings quoted by Brother Len that focus on the person and love of God and His Christ intertwined in the message, quite a few from Wesley. There is also some time spent on some of the past saints that exemplified this love.

sermons.title: 1 Cor 13 (version 2)
sermons.description: This sermon focuses on God's kind of love from the verses written by Paul in 1 Corinthians 13 and Romans 5:5. The majority of the sermon discusses the first half of 1 Cor 13; specifically verses 1 through 8. There are many old hymns and writings quoted by Brother Len that focus on the person and love of God and His Christ intertwined in the message, quite a few from Wesley. There is also some time spent on some of the past saints that exemplified this love.

sermons.title: A Love That Never Gives Up
Being Big Hearted
sermons.description: Verwer believes that as Christians, we need more vision and more love. Avoiding narrow-mindedness is key when trying to accomplish the Great Commission together with all of our brothers and sisters in Christ. Divisions between denominations and views of the Holy Spirit must be minimized as we seek to "fellowship with all of God’s people

sermons.title: Channels of Love and The Catheterized Heart
sermons.description: The word Â“mercyÂ” means Â“unconditional love.Â” When David writes in Psalm 23:6 that mercy will follow him all the days of his life, the word he uses for Â“followÂ” actually means Â“pursue.Â” GodÂ’s unconditional love will pursue David all of his life. This is the kind of love for others that we must have too, if we are to be like God.

sermons.title: Do Everything Out Of Love
sermons.description: Arno Stegen shares his sermon on the topic of having the love of God in our lifes. He speaks of many practical ways to show if we do nor do not have the love of God in our heart. All ministry, work, and serving God can be vain without it being done out of love from the heart for God. This is a very challenging and strong sermon on a much needed topic to be shared.

sermons.title: I John - Love Comes from God
II Peter - How Real is your Love?
In The Shadow Of The Cross - Love Stooped to Serve
Love - The Heart Of Christian Experience
Love-Portrait of Christ and the Christian
Manifesting Christ by Walking in Suffering Love
Perfect Love of the Father Casts Out Fear
Prayer Of Love Is Our Witness
Sermon On The Mount IV - The Reign Of Abba's Love
Superabounding Love
sermons.description: We all go through hard times and encounter hurtful, hateful people. Every day on the news there are more reports of global tragedy. Letâ€™s face it; itâ€™s a hard cruel world. But Godâ€™s love covers it all! What this old world needs is a good dose of Godâ€™s love. Godâ€™s love can take it. Godâ€™s love can fix it. And Godâ€™s love can enable you to deal with it; whatever it may be.

sermons.title: The Greatest Thing In The World
sermons.description: God is love. Pastor Cymbala explores what this really means and how we should live out this life of love as a follower of Christ.

sermons.title: The Greatest of These is Love
The Key to Understanding
sermons.description: The commandment given by God is to love Him with all ours hearts, souls and minds...and this love is to embrace our neighbors. The Son of God is concerned about people.

sermons.title: The Nature of Good and the Nature of Evil
sermons.description: When God created the world it was a picture of perfect beauty and harmony. Sin came, and the nature of evil to destroy and bring disunity was revealed. God's desire now for us as His children is to reflect His nature of unselfish love that gives. By dwelling in Him our lives can be lived with a beauty and harmony that will bring forth fruit.

sermons.title: The Reality Of The Love Of Jesus Christ
sermons.description: Corrie Ten Boom shares her testimony of walking with the Lord Jesus 75 for years. Her times of struggle in terrible persecutions and imprisonment. What joy and happiness she has recounting her life and walk with the Lord Jesus.

sermons.title: The Willingness to Love
sermons.description: December 14, 2008 - It's not easy to love people. How can we love people the way Christ loves us? Loving others is hopeless unless we abide in Christ and allow Him to do through us what we cannot do for ourselves. It has to be Christ in us - the newness of His life and love flowing in us and through us. Unconditional giving of ourselves is the basis for an explosion of joy! Start loving and be ready for the miraculous.

sermons.title: Touch of Love
sermons.description: This message by K.P. Yohannan expresses the great need we have to demonstrate our love for the Lord by helping children in need throughout Asia. â€œI want to do unto others not out of guilt or shame but because I love my Lord. How can I say I love someone with my words yet show no action of love?? In 1 John 3:18 Jesus says â€œDear children, let's not merely say that we love each other; let us show the truth by our actionsâ€ (NLT) I pray that what K.P. says, hits your heart the way it did mine.â€

sermons.title: Week Of Meetings 01 The Love Of God
What Is Love? The Root of Self-Seeking
sermons.description: Brother Brian shares about the love of God. He defines it Biblically and gives many examples of how much love means to God and each believer. He exhorts us to seek and pursue love above all things. Love is not selfish, he shows clearly that the root of love is not self-seeking. A great challenging message to all of us.
